Reviews.Title: Nice H.264 outdoor camera
Reviews.Author: Wen
Reviews.Content: I got three of these Esky cams 3 weeks ago and have put them in position. I have one for the dining room with the back door in view, a second one in the porch with the front door in view and a third one to monitor my garage. I'm not tech savvy--but it only took me 1 days by the consultation with the esky technique guy to figure out how to "port forward" these to work via the wireless router--to view on web or mobile phone app. I thought i had to purchase third party software to run them on the internet and/or open an account at dyndns. I discovered i was wrong on both counts. These cams have built-in DDNS and free software and is really user-friendly.The most amazing part is the IR-CUT lens. The built-in IR-cut filter in H6800 blocks infrared light to make image colors more realistic. The H6800 would be the ideal solution for people who either need a high quality camera or want to replace the dumb cameras without IR-cut. I think you'll love them.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera. Worked well for what I needed.
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after having some issues with vandalism. I tried a few options for camera systems, this being one of them.I was pleased with the quality of the camera itself after taking it out of the box. It seemed sturdy and appeared to be waterproof as they say. There is a removable metal shield on the top of the camera to protect it. One issue I ran into right out of the box was the lack of the micro SD card slot. A quick call to customer service informed me the slot is accessed by removing the back panel of the camera. This, I guess, would add to the waterproofing. Customer service was very helpful; I called the number and a real person answered, rare these days.I then set up the camera. It was actually fairly easy with the included software. I did have to manually set up port forwarding on my router to get it to work correctly, but I do have an old off brand router. The recording software is also fairly user friendly. Once I played with the settings a bit, I found this camera recording software had all the options I needed for my situation.I am pleased with the purchase and it has been up and running for about 2 weeks now with few issues. One issue required me to power off and power on the camera to fix. The other was an issue with my computer and unrelated to the camera or software.

Reviews.Title: simply doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Madtown
Reviews.Content: the camera does power on, but that is about it.  None of the directions I received in the box are accurate nor could I connect to the camera either by the included application or a web browser.  The esky website is a joke and doesn't even have the software for this camera on it.  I called customer service and was just prompted to leave a message.  I'm returning this awful product to amazon.

Reviews.Title: Amazing produce, I am going to order some more.
Reviews.Author: MS
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for 4 weeks now. No problem at all. Ordered in September, called the tech support to walk me through installation. I am very impressed with tech support. The guy stay on the phone for hours to help me and education me how to use the system. I am in my 50, not very good about the computer. The technician help me all the way. I am very please.The camera works like a charm. Feel more secure with the camera now day.I bought the SD card 32GB and recording 24/7.  LOVE IT.  I am going to order another one for my pool area because I have people come and maintenance my pool and my yard every week. I can keep an eye on my vacation home from now on since we are not live there but few weeks a year. I can watch on my Iphone also... Cool.Thank you ESKY for making the great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Donald Messersmith
Reviews.Content: This camera has its own dns and you can view from anywhere. It also has clear video and user friendly. I would recommend this camera for a great  security solution for your home or business

Reviews.Title: My second Esky IP cam
Reviews.Author: doglady
Reviews.Content: I bought this outdoor camera because I had got the C5900, another camera model of Esky for month ago and satisfied with its performance. This camera carries on the outstanding part of c5900 in deep. The live video is fluent with high quality, consuming low bandwidth comparing wansview ncb543w I bought before. The IR-cut lens makes the image more realistic and vivid. Another point impresses me is, unlike Foscam camera, that it provides permanent-free DDNS service enabling easy access to the camera when I am away from home. If you firstly use Esky H6800 and know little about network setting, I highly recommend you asking their technique support for help, who will do you a great favor and save you time and energy. I rated the H6800 camera 5 stars not because it’s that perfect. Actually, its software and control panel has little difference with c5900, useful but a little tough, not easy to use, high space for improvement. Wish this will be better in near feature. The camera indicates that it could not support audio (microphone and speaker), which would not be shortage for me for my backyard security. That depends.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera, but could not get it to work via WiFi
Reviews.Author: Peter Matusov
Reviews.Content: No matter what I did, I could not get the camera connect to the router via WiFi. It worked just fine via Ethernet cable. Having to run the network cable across the entire house is not what I planned to do when I purchased the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good image but poor software
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: Image quality is very good. Unfortunately, the software is not. It does not have very many features and the record to SD card feature does not playback very well. The desktop client records in AVI format but the SD card records in H264 format. Ordinarily this wouldn't be a problem but it doesn't appear to be a standard .264 format so playback is difficult to achieve with third party viewers and the manufacturer doesn't offer any playback viewers on the website. What's worse is the desktop application does not appear to be capable of playing the downloaded h264 format files. HUGE FLAW. What's the point in having recorded video if you can't play it back using the desktop client? Web access is very limited and many of the features are not available at all over the web. This also depends on the type of browser you're using. I had to use a combination of Firefox and IE just to get the playback to work. In addition, the SD card is inside the unit requiring the user to break the seal, which according to the sticker voids the warranty. Good thing the seller was very good about honoring the warranty anyway because due to the software issues I returned this camera.Also, side note: I couldn't get the motion record to work at all.

Reviews.Title: Setup Failed - Could not find wireless network
Reviews.Author: Robert D Bartizek
Reviews.Content: I spent several hours over 3 days trying to get this camera to work properly.  Following the setup program, the camera would work when connected to my D-Link wireless router by an ethernet cable.  When I got to the step where the setup is supposed to scan for wireless networks, it could never find my network.  The company's website was no help at all.  Troubleshooting tips say to download new firmware and software but these items were not available for download from the site.  In reading other reviews for this camera, some people have no trouble setting it up while others couldn't get it to work.  I hoped I would be among the lucky ones.  Guess not.  I'm sending it back.

Reviews.Title: Decent hardware but bad software and no technical support.
Reviews.Author: Vaughn "The answer man!"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget outdoor IP camera, I would say this camera fits that bill, but there are some caveats.Pros:Low cost, durable quality and decent image.Cons:Non existent tech support and technical information and bad software.  Also, the remote access feature does not work if you have a WIMAX internet service ( true for most IP cams that rely on port forwarding for remote access).  Has an internal SD card slot that requires voiding the warranty to access.VIDEO QUALITY:While this camera does do what it is designed for, there are a few things that you should know about it.  One it is a standard VGA video unit. Don't let the H.264 fool you into thinking you are getting a higher quality. H.264 refers to the video compression standard. That being said, I would say that the video from this camera might be ever so slightly clearer compared to my Foscam FI8910 IP camera.BUILD QUALITY:As far as the build of the camera, structurally it feels solid and well built.SOFTWARE:This camera comes bundled with  IP Camera Super Client.  This software is not fully compatible with the firmware of the camera.  While some features work well, other features like modifying motion detection sensitivity do not work well with the firmware of the camera.  The camera does have a web interface that works well, but is very limited compared to the functionality of the IP Camera Super ClientTECHNICAL SUPPORT:LOL! What techincal support.  Just to give you an idea of how "Fly By Night" this ESKY company is, go to their website and see for yourself that the H6800 is not even listed in their product line. Try doing a site search for H6800 and you will get no results.  I have spent hours trying to find an actual manual for the H6800.  It does not exist.  Honestly though, there are several other cameras offered by Foscam and others that look identical to this one and also do not have any technical manuals or information that apply specifically to this model.  I tried to give ESKY a call but both numbers I tried went straight to an old fashion cheap answering machine (you know, the "Please leave your name and number" kind you used to have in with your land line in the 1990s) with no option to hold.THE MYSTERIOUS SD CARD SLOT:The H6800 is advertised as having a Micro SD card slot that will hold up to a 32Gb card.  I have search this camera over with a fine tooth comb and this card slot does not exist. There are no official instructions anywhere on the internet as to where this card slot is or the proper way to access it.  Some have said that the slot is located inside the camera.  The only way to get inside the camera is to take it apart which will break the warranty seal voiding the warranty. Even so, I have tried opening the camera up, but could not find a way to do it without causing potential damage to camera. At risk of breaking the camera, I took the back off and looked inside the camera.  There was no SD card slot visible. After trying unsuccessfully to find a way to get the guts of the camera out of the without breaking something, I put it back to gather and prayed that it still worked.  Bottom line.  Until I see an "OFFICIAL" set of detail instructions (that currently does not exist) on how to insert an SD card into this camera without voiding the warranty, I am going to say that, for all intents and purpose, this camera does not have the "Advertised" micro sd slot, or at least not one that is accessible to the common person.REMOTE ACCESS:I live out in the country with no options for high speed internet access other then WIMAX.  I have great service and can watch online streaming video from Netflix or Amazon Video with no problem.  But because of the router hardware needed to get service to me, I cannot access remotely IP cameras that depend on port forwarding.  So if you have WIMAX internet service, just know that you will not be able to remotely access this camera.THE BOTTOM LINE:For what it is, it does an okay job if all you are looking for is a basic VGA outdoor camera.  If you needs are beyond that, or God forbid you needs some technical help, you are plumb out of luck.

Reviews.Title: Waste of a couple of hours trying to set up.
Reviews.Author: HeavyB
Reviews.Content: I'm an IT professional, and I've installed several ip cameras.  This thing powered up, had Ethernet connectivity, and ir worked, but I couldn't find it on the network.  The cd was unusable (scratched very badly as if it had been scrubbed with sandpaper), so I had no software.  The website didn't have a download for this camera, so I tried one of the others, and it wouldn't "find" the camera on my network.  The documentation said that the IP address was on the bottom, but it wasn't.  I ran an ip scanner, and apparently the default isn't in the 192.168.1.x range.  After 2 hours, i'm returning, since there was only a "leave a message" at their helpline during normal business hours.  I guess I'll be buying fanother more reputable brand.  Steer clear of these...

Reviews.Title: Got it on a whim but highly impressed
Reviews.Author: Aveg
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Esky IP camera as a security measure for my house, but totally on a whim. Well, the Internet camera thing is something I call a tech blind spot for me. Luckily, a techie friend came to my help and got everything done almost in the blink of an eye. I really love that IP night vision part. Its just ineffably funny to watch whats going on outside in the dead of night.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup and impressively waterproof
Reviews.Author: Chanchal Rawat "Cee R"
Reviews.Content: I got this IP camera installed right outside my garage door. I thought the setup would be monstrously complicated prior to my purchase. Yet, things took a flip for the much better when I really got it in my hands and then got everything going smoothly. The seemingly aluminum-metallic protective housing is pretty impressive and makes me dead sure about its waterproof properties.

Reviews.Title: 1 week review - Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Cody Mouret
Reviews.Content: Overall this camera did everything I needed it to (Outdoor rated / nightvision / sdcard dvr / wifi / built in alerts) for the price, I couldn't pass it up. I added an 8GB micro sd card, this seems to store about 3-4 days recording @ ~8 hours at night when we sleep. This is at the highest quality (max resolution / max variable bit rate / 30fps). I plan to expand this to 32gb in the near future so it can store about a week for vacations.My camera's static IP was set to 192.168.1.126 out of the box also. Access the camera by plugging in via provided ethernet cable to your router, and typing in 192.168.1.126:81 in the browser bar.  (Or whatever IP your camera is set to)My router was initially set to DHCP addresses in the range of 192.168.11.x, so I had to temporarily set to 192.168.1.x in order to access the internal setup of the camera. After that everything was straight forward.Free iPhone app "CamViewer" works great with this. (In the app select Add new IP Camera > Apexis H Series)I will probably look into the Esky C5900 for pan and tilt function next.

Reviews.Title: dead on arrival
Reviews.Author: T.M.
Reviews.Content: right out of the box the camera would not power on. contacted the manufacture tech support they seemed to care. product returned.

Reviews.Title: It works
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The hardware is decent. Waterproof and handles light conditions well. The image quality is okay.The documentation is poor and the IP information is incorrect... My unit booted to http://192.168.1.126:81!All features work minimally, I've tested the E-Mail, FTP and motion detection features.The WiFi setup was terrible and the user password has a max size of 7 characters!It's a Linux based camera! Where's the source code so a few hackers can make this thing feature complete.Decent hardware. Poor firmware.Do not buy unless you are technical.

Reviews.Title: Confusing to set up, but nice picture.
Reviews.Author: Ron Howard
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these, for the front and back of my house. Reading the installation directions and using a new Cisco router made me think the install would be a snap. BUT, first off - like many reviews have mentioned, my router did not communicate with the camera with the initial LAN cable as directed. After calling a very helpful technician at the number on their website, I found that a direct LAN connection from the camera to the computer would allow for the procedure. Keep in mind that 'Step 1 Find Camera' may take a couple of minutes. It worked after the tech manually adjusted a few parameters. I learned from that and installed the 2nd camera with no problems. They are now working through a wireless connection with a beautiful picture that I can access either through the network or remotely through my smartphone and any other computer. Beware of claims that this H6800 model has audio - it does not. I have yet to add miniSD cards and check the motion alerts. I'll report back shortly.

Reviews.Title: Impressed with night visibility
Reviews.Author: BluegrassFan
Reviews.Content: I've been so frequently disappointed with poor performing cameras, that I didn't expect much from this. But it is surprisingly good, out to at least 25 feet at night.Unlike other reviewers, I had no problem quickly setting up the wireless connection to my WPA2-PSK network.Two complaints:1. The IR LEDs emit enough visible red (to my eyes) that it's obvious you have a camera mounted on your house. I purchased some IR cut-on plastic filter to suppress it (with a hole in the middle for the camera lens).2. To add a memory card, you do have to unscrew the back of the camera, which breaks a label that voids the warranty. This is an undocumented feature, but some other reviewer posted the information, and is a reason I bought this particular camera.

Reviews.Title: This will be the 4th one-star review in a row left for this item
Reviews.Author: WWolvesLondon "WWolvesLondon"
Reviews.Content: This review is mostly about the seller, BetterStuff LowerPrice, but at this time they are the only seller of this camera on Amazon.The software CD was broken when the camera arrived, which can happen from time to time, but it looked like it was hit with a hammer a couple of times, so it was probably broken before it was packed as it didn't look like that would have happened during travel.The manual indicates that the operating software can be obtained online, but the page it directs you to only lists software for other cameras that is a couple of years old, which is older than this camera design.The seller's website has broken graphics and looks as if nobody has tended to it for a long time. That doesn't engender a lot of confidence.I emailed the seller a couple of times, beginning as soon as the camera arrived and they haven't responded.The lights on the camera worked and it made clicking noises once in a while, so at least it wasn't dead. But my computer didn't see it. Since I can't get the right software to set it up, it is being returned.The seller needs to get serious about this business or quit wasting everyone's time.

Reviews.Title: Baffling and ominous
Reviews.Author: Andrew Bean
Reviews.Content: Following instructions, the camera could not be recognized by my computers and configured.  I am somewhat configuration proficient.  It seems that to get this thing going requires patience, luck, and trial and error, at least according to the message boards that I saw.  I would say that set up is beyond the average home-owner.It did not help that the instructions provided with the unit and online did not match the unit's model number.I did not have the time for this science project.More troubling: the rear of the unit indicated that the Remote access was on http://aauwn.ipcam.so.  The user name by default is "admin" and there is no password by default.  ".SO" is a root domain (like .COM) that indicates that it is registered in the country of Somalia.  Does this mean that people in Somalia have the ability to see through these cameras?  I did not want to find out.I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Ran for about 15 seconds
Reviews.Author: sculin
Reviews.Content: As soon as power was supplied, a crackle sound came from within the camera body. At that point the monitor led on the power supply got dim and began to blink at a very high rate. The IR led's would not come on and the software was unable to locate the camera (Dead). I called the support phone but gave up after 24 rings. No response from the E-Mail support group either. Returned to Amazon for a refund. Will try yet another manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: H6800 intstallation problems
Reviews.Author: ken
Reviews.Content: I am greatly disappointed in the Esky H6800 IP camera's setup instructions (both hard copy provided and online)!The instructions that came with the camera do not work and the online support is pretty much non-existent.  I've tried calling into their service/support phone number but, although I am calling after 9AM PDT (as indicated in the set-up instructions), I get no answer, no matter how many times I try calling throughout the day.I am surprised that online blogs and critiques are not replete with disappointment about their service.  Needless to say, if I can't get help setting up the camera, it is of no use to me and I will be returning it.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money - interferes with gate opener receivers
Reviews.Author: Idaho Hunter "Skeeter"
Reviews.Content: 30 August 2013 update:  I tried to use this camera to monitor a remote location which has an electric gate opener.  Even with Wi-Fi turned off, this camera emits enough noise that it disables the gate opener receiver.  I've read that other cameras (Foscam especially) that do the same thing with garage door openers.  I can't believe the FCC allows these Chinese camera makers to produce equipment that emits such noise.  If you plan to install this camera near any garage or gate opener, think twice since it probably will result in disappointment.If you own their C5900 indoor cameras (which are pretty good), you will probably like this model.  This is their 1st outdoor rated model which has H.264 and SD card recording.  It may have been mentioned before, but this model uses a standard sized SD card (the size is not clear in the product's description# (I am using a class 10 32GB card) which is somewhat of a challenge to insert inside the camera once you have the back removed.  It took me several attempts to get it inserted correctly and then it works fine.  Also, this camera, unlike the 5900 models, does NOT have any provisions to allow audio.  There are no audio connections available nor speaker connections despite this company's claim that it does have this ability on eBay.  The box it came in had white tape over the audio in and out mentions.  Also, be aware the camera comes set with a 192.168.1.xxx #in my case 126) address so you will have to first set your computers LAN port to 192.168.1.xxx and then connect this camera to your computer's lan port.  Then run the software and change it to whatever your want.  Unless your router has the 192.168.1.xxx address, you will likely not find this camera.Esky has a LONG way to go before it is a player in the IP camera business, but for the price if you are willing to spend the time to get it going, this is a nice camera.  Esky seems to be a reseller of Chinese cameras and is staffed by Chinese folks who have a difficult time explaining anything in Chinglish, if they even reply at all (which most times they won't becauce they don't have a clue to any solutions).  Go to their forum site and see what I mean:  http://www.eskynow.com/forum/.  If you have 2 and 1/2 times the money I would suggest checking out the Microseven M7-RC650WS which is a Mercedes compared to this Yugo.Am I happy?  I guess so.  It's only 30 bucks more than their C5900 model but it works outdoors.  If I had more money to spend, I would definitely go with the $249 Microseven M7-RC650WS which is 50 bucks cheaper on their website than here.

ProductInfo.Features:
Full-fledged surveillance management PC software included for free
Motion-triggered alerts sent to your email or FTP server
Easy set up and configuration; Supports WEP/WPA/WPA2 encryption
Multiple protocols supported, Image transmission using an e-mail or FTP
30 IR Led lights providing 20m night vison distance
ProductInfo.Name: Esky® H6800 H.264 Waterproof Outdoor Wireless Wifi Bullet IP Camera with IR-Cut Filter, Night-Vision, 640X480, Micro SD card Supported, 30 LEDs
